intro: Ipomoea verrucipes, commonly known as the roughleaf morning glory, is a flowering vine native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves that are covered in small, rough bumps, giving it a textured appearance. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found growing along stream banks or in disturbed soils. Ipomoea verrucipes is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many other species of morning glories.
